column4: i am installing ubuntu from the 7.04 live cd and i want to leave a partition untouched by the installer
If you don't specify for the live CD installer to format a partition, it shouldn't touch it.
i got this WARNING: This will destroy all data on any partitions you have removed as
It will destroy data **on partitions you've removed or marked to be formatted** -- that means ones you haven't removed, or marked to format, will not be deleted.
define 'removed'. i have a apartition i didn't touch in the installer but there is an option where you set / and /home to instead set 'don'tuse'
I don't think that setting something to "don't use" means "remove this partition". Removing a partition would be, for example, deleting your Windows partition to make more room for Ubuntu.
i didn't set it to don't use, i didn't set it to anything, should i?
I think it should only use a partition if you tell it to do so.
i have 4 parts on the drive, linux swap, / and /home, and one i am just temp storing files - i did not go near that part in the install
ty
Just read carefully and you should be good. It's difficult for me to say anything for sure because I don't have the installer in front of me.
If you want extra peace of mind, screenshot it and I'll take a look. :-)
i'm just not confident continuing with the warning WARNING: This will destroy all data on any partitions you have removed as
The thing is, the warning is true and it means exactly what it says.
It will give you that warning no matter what you do, because it needs to format at least a few parititions to install.
it could mean *all data, which includes my storage partition
The warning is to make you think carefully about which parititions you chose to format.
ok, lets see what happens
You might be interested in using the Disk Usage Analyzer.
thanks that's a nice program. i'm trying to get accustomed to term commands
Ah, in that case df is very nice.
